text.p: In this lab exercise, you are tasked to write a piece of Java code to calculate the area of a triangle using the formula:
The calculated result is then outputted on the screen.

ol.li: The Java code should first ask the user to input the width of the triangle by outputting a message on the screen. The format of the message must be Enter the width of the triangle: . Notice that the message ends with a colon followed by a space (i.e. ": ") and the printing position should not be moved to a new line. The program will then allow the user to input the width of the triangle. After that, the inputted width from the user is stored by using a variable.
Repeat the previous step to get the height of the triangle.
Calculate the area of the triangle using the formula indicated above, after getting the width and the height. Store the result by using a variable.

Lastly, output a message on the screen to report the calculated area. The format of the message must be The triangle area = calculated_area, with calculated_area replaced by the result obtained. Notice that there must be an equal sign followed by a space (i.e. "= ") just before the calculated_area in the message.
